definition: the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: 'I liked the place where the bundles fell off and tumbled downstairs, ' said Meg.
sentences.chinese: “我喜欢背囊掉下来后挡住楼梯那一段”，玫说。

sentences.english: so they don’t take inv space. but apparently you an only hold 10 you’re not using.

sentences.english: He was complete now with that knapsack on.
sentences.chinese: 背上了那个背囊，如今他就样样俱全了。

sentences.english: And then removed from the backpack of my gift, I gave him my most beautiful smile.
sentences.chinese: 然后从背囊里取出我的礼物，我给他我最美丽的微笑。

sentences.english: The order was given to halt and take off their knapsacks .
sentences.chinese: 发出了停止前进，取下背囊的命令。

sentences.english: The soldiers in the unit carry 85-100-pound rucksacks .
sentences.chinese: 这支部队的士兵要背85至100磅重的背囊。

sentences.english: Tidy up knapsack of leaving the country distant journey.
You can take your rucksacks and sleeping bags in now.

sentences.english: This paper introduces the surgeon backpack and medical corpsman backpack which are newly developed for PLA.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了我军新研制的军医背囊与卫生员背囊。

sentences.english: This paper introduces the surgeon backpack and medical corpsman backpack which are newly developed for PLA.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了我军新研制的军医背囊与卫生员背囊。

sentences.english: Prefer a kitbag in your short-distance journey now?
sentences.chinese: 现在会想要一个这样的背囊来伴随你的短途旅行吗？

sentences.english: A few belongings can exactly how many education tools?

definition: pouch/sack/bag/Budai (the Laughing Buddha)/Budai or Putai town in Chiayi county 嘉義縣|嘉义县[Jia1 yi4 xian4], west Taiwan
cloth pouch open in the middle, forming two bags/jacket worn for Chinese wrestling
full and bulging (of a pocket, pouch etc)
a basket carried on the back
